intro: Obione transandina, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to cool, humid climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. Obione transandina is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
